byline.contributor: Steve Eder, Amy Chozick and Kitty Bennett contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

abstract: Corey Lewandowski, presidential campaign manager to Donald J Trump, is charged with battery by police in Jupiter, Fla, for grabbing reporter Michelle Fields as she attempted to question Trump; surrenders to police and is quickly released; claims by Lewandowski and Trump that no violence occurred are contradicted by video evidence, leading to condemnations from Trump's detractors.
lead_paragraph: His formal arrest was detailed in a police report that cited new security-camera images showing Mr. Lewandowski pulling a reporter out of his way after Mr. Trump spoke in Florida on March 8.

headline.main: Corey Lewandowski, Donald Trump’s Campaign Manager, Is Charged With Battery
headline.print_headline: Trump Campaign Chief Charged With Battery

snippet: His formal arrest was detailed in a police report that cited new security-camera images showing Mr. Lewandowski pulling a reporter out of his way after Mr. Trump spoke in Florida on March 8.
